ACT
233
Acquisition from heir apparent
Whoever, in good faith, on the occasion of acquiring a thing or right belonging to the decedent's heir, acted with confidence in the veracity of the valid decision on inheritance, not knowing that this determination was not true regarding the person from whom he acquired it, nevertheless acquired that thing or right as he would have acquired it if the alienator really had the inheritance right as stated in the final decision on inheritance.
This does not affect the provisions on the acquisition by trust in the truthfulness and completeness of land registers, nor the provisions on the acquisition of movable property from non-owners.
